title.narrative: Armstrong South East Asia Clean Energy Fund, L.P.

description.narrative: IFC is proposing an equity investment of up to US$20 million in Armstrong South East Asia Clean Energy Fund, L.P. (Armstrong Fund or the Fund), a 10-year closed-end private equity fund focusing on climate businesses targeting US$150 million of commitments. The Fund conducted its initial closing in August 2012 with US$65 million in commitments from institutional and corporate investors. The Armstrong Fund intends to make approximately 10 equity and equity-like investments in South East Asia in the range of US$5 million and US$20 million. The Fund will target businesses that develop, construct, own and operate renewable energy generation and resource efficiency projects. Initially the Fund intends to particularly target opportunities in the solar-energy market in Thailand and the small-scale hydro-electric power market in Indonesia.

IFC's investment in the Fund is expected to have the following development impact: (i) The Fund will support the mitigation of climate change through reduced GHG emissions per unit of energy produced by their investee companies relative to conventional energy sources; (ii) The Fund will catalyze the role and growth of the private sector in the South East Asian Power markets by investing in small-scale Independent Power Producers (IPPs). It will help provide access to power to the broader population in the target countries; (iii) The Fund will help its investees grow sustainably and create jobs directly and indirectly.

name.narrative: The Fund is registered and managed from the Republic of Singapore. It focuses on greenfield and brownfield investments in renewable energy generation in South East Asia. In its initial phase the Fund is considering opportunities in the solar-energy market in Thailand and the small-scale hydro-electric power market in Indonesia. The Fund may also invest in projects in other renewable energy sub-sectors within South East Asia.
